results.title: Expanding math skills with the mini-calculator: problem solving
results.creator_credit: Susan Norton, James M. Smith, Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a variety of classroom situations in which teachers use calculators to help students comprehend mathematical relationships. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Expanding math skills with the mini-calculator: classroom management
results.creator_credit: Susan Norton, James M. Smith, Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Offers practical suggestions for integrating calculators into elementary, advanced and remedial mathematics programs and recommends methods of evaluating students’ progress. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Expanding math skills with the mini-calculator: introduction
results.creator_credit: Louis Hough, Susan Norton, James M. Smith, Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Many examples demonstrate how teachers can use mini-calculators to motivate and augment learning, check student work, explore number patterns and sequences, examine decimals, estimate solutions and stimulate mathematical curiosity and creativity. Students are shown in class and on field trips as they solve a variety of problems with the calculator. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Dogs, cats and rabbits
results.brief_description: An amusing animated non-narrated film in three parts. Part one: 41 Barks - animated impressions of dogs, drawn and barked by Eliot Noyes Jr. Part two: Catsup - by Lana Hoban with music “Alley cat” by Frank Bjorn, played by Bent Fabric and a cast of five cats Part three: Rabbits, texture, shape and fun with drawings by Bill Stitt. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics
results.creator_credit: Aesop Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: To fix her broken ship Captain Huff must buy new rivets and a rudder. At the store she uses a calculator to make unit price comparisons, a 10% discount, sales tax and delivery charges. An animated film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.title_for_label: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics

results.title: Artimus and old laces
results.brief_description: An important concept, the distributive principle, is illustrated in this animated tale about the multiplication problems of Cyrus Squeeze, tax collector. His niece Louise helps out by picturing each problem as areas or rectangular arrays, which she then adds up for the final product. No other credits available.

results.title: About your body. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part film using animation and the setting of a doctor’s surgery to discuss the skeletal, muscular, nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems of the human body. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Little athletics: sprinting
results.creator_credit: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Skills and exercises needed for successful sprinting are explained and demonstrated in this film. These include techniques of body movement, relaxation and also the methods of starting and running the race. This film is interspersed with some shots of Australian women sprinters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
